title: 🗓️ Week 02 - Basic concepts of SAR
text:
In this week, we will review basic concepts of synthetic aperture radar (SAR).
In addition, we will follow a tutorial to learn how to classify land cover using SAR data.

title: 🗓️ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Statement 1
Satellites measure the reflectance of features on the ground

title: 🗓️ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Statement 2
Land cover classification is a simple process of grouping pixels based on spectral properties

title: 🗓️ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Statement 3
Spectral resolution is the number of bands available from a particular sensor

title: 🗓️ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Statement 4
Measuring the differences between two land cover maps created from imagery acquired at different times will provide the most reliable estimate of land cover change.

title: 🗓️ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Statement 5
Landsat TM imagery is suitable to consistently classify natural vegetation genus and species information with a high level of accuracy

title: 🗓️ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Statement 6
Square pixels in an image accurately represent a square area on the Earth’s surface

Basic python quiz

title: 🗓️ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Reading, doing and writing
A flipped classroom is structured around the idea that lecture or direct instruction is not the best use of class time. Instead students encounter information before class, freeing class time for activities that involve higher order thinking

title: 🗓️ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Read this document
This chapter focuses on Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) data. It provides an introduction to SAR systems and detail how data are acquired, whereas the main parameters are introduced. Radar systems are based on the interaction of the radar emitted and transmitted signals with targets.
Frery, Wu and Gomez, 2022. SAR Image Analysis— A Computational Statistics Approach with R Code, Data, and Applications

title: 🗓️ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Watch this video
In this talk, the basics of Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) are introduced. It starts with an overview of the heritage of SAR and give a clear and comprehensive picture of SAR imaging techniques. You’ll learn how SAR sensors work and what they measure. It explains standard SAR imaging modes and the unique advantages SAR can deliver.
Speaker: Tom Ager (ICEYE)



2027449 – PERCEPCION REMOTA AVANZADA

Aprobación del curso Percepción Remota
Aprobación del curso Programación SIG

title: 2027449 - PERCEPCION REMOTA AVANZADA
text:
DESCRIPCIÓN DE LA ASIGNATURA:






OBJETIVOS:






Entender el proceso de percepción remota de la superficie terrestre y su relación con la investigación
Conocer los principios físicos de la percepción remota basada en radar de apertura sintética (SAR)
Entender las características principales de las imágenes y los métodos de corrección radiométrica y geométrica de imágenes SAR
Aplicar métodos y técnicas avanzadas para obtener información temática a partir de imágenes ópticas y SAR


COMPETENCIAS GENÉRICAS:

Comprensión de los fundamentos teóricos de la percepción remota
Obtención de habilidades prácticas para seleccionar, procesar y analizar imágenes
Desarrollo de pensamiento crítico sobre las ventajas y las limitaciones de la percepción remota



COMPETENCIAS ESPECÍFICAS:

Entendimiento del flujo de trabajo genérico de percepción remota
Adaptación y creación de scripts para procesamiento y análisis de imágenes
Evaluación de la calidad de productos de percepción remota



METODOLOGIA:

Lectura antes de la clase a cargo del estudiante
Presentación de conceptos, métodos y técnicas a cargo del profesor
Realización de ejercicios prácticos y elaboración de reportes técnicos a cargo del estudiante



SOFTWARE

PARTE 1: Sentinel-1 Toolbox (S1TBX)
PARTE 2: Python & Jupyter & Google Colaboratory

title: 2027449 - PERCEPCION REMOTA AVANZADA
text:
CONTENIDO DETALLADO






PARTE 1 – RADAR DE APERTURA SINTETICA (SAR)






Semana 1 – Repaso, Contexto & Conceptos claves


Semana 2 - Conceptos básicos de radar


Semana 3 - Procesamiento básico de imágenes SAR - SNAP


Semana 4 – Propiedades radiativas de suelos y vegetación


Semana 5 – Procesamiento básico de imágenes SAR - GEE - JS


Semana 6 – Procesamiento básico de imágenes SAR - GEE - Python


Semana 7 – Analysis Ready SAR Data


Semana 8 – Open Data Cube










PARTE 2 – APRENDIZAJE PROFUNDO (DEEP LEARNING)






Semana 9 – Fundamentos de Deep Learning (DL)


Semana 10 – Redes neuronales convolucionales


Semana 11 - Clasificación de imágenes


Semana 12 - Segmentación semántica I


Semana 13 - Deep Learning for remote sensing


Semana 14 - Segmentación semántica II


Semana 15 - Aplicaciones DL en vegetación


Semana 16 - Aplicaciones DL en recursos hídricos

title: 2027449 - PERCEPCION REMOTA AVANZADA
text:
EVALUACIÓN DEL CURSO:






Important






Presentación de dos exámenes escritos sobre aspectos teóricos (50%)

Examen 1 - 20 de Septiembre
Examen 2 - 22 de Noviembre

Entrega de dos informes técnicos (50%)

Informe 1 - 27 de Septiembre
Informe 2 - 29 de Noviembre

title: 2027449 - PERCEPCION REMOTA AVANZADA
text:
BIBLIOGRAFIA






Important





Chollet, F. Deep Learning with Python [2nd ed.], Manning, 2021. 504 pp.
De Grandi, G.D. et al. Spatial Analysis for Radar Remote Sensing of Tropical Forests, CRC Press, 2021. 380pp.
Flores-Anderson, A.I. et al. The Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) Handbook: Comprehensive Methodologies for Forest Monitoring and Biomass Estimation, SERVIR GLOBAL & SilvaCarbon, 2019. 307 pp.
Frery, A.C. et al. SAR Image Analysis - A Computational Statistics Approach: With R Code, Data, and Applications, Wiley-IEEE Press, 2022. 208 pp.
Kamusoko, C., Optical and SAR Remote Sensing of Urban Areas: A Practical Guide, Springer, 2021. 130 pp.
Mandal, D. et al. Radar Remote Sensing for Crop Biophysical Parameter Estimation, Springer, 2021. 236 pp.
Raff, E. Inside Deep Learning – Math, Algorithms, Models, Manning, 2022. 565 pp.
Rees, W.G. Physical Principles of Remote Sensing [3rd ed.], Cambridge University Press, 2012. 494 pp.
Richards, J.A. Remote Sensing Digital Image Analysis Sensing [6th ed.], Springer, 2022. 567 pp.
Simms, E.L. SAR Image Interpretation for Various Land Covers – A Practical Guide. CRC Press, 2011. 376 pp. 
Ustin, S.L., and Middleton E.M. Current and near-term advances in Earth observation for ecological applications. Ecological Processes, 2021, 10:1 Woodhouse, I.H. Introduction to Microwave Remote Sensing, Taylor & Francis, 2022. 370 pp. 
Yamaguchi, Y. Polarimetric SAR imaging: theory and applications. CRC Press, 2020. 350 pp.

title: 2027449 - PERCEPCION REMOTA AVANZADA
text:
📑 Course Brief
Focus: the focus of this course is to gain knowledge for developing novel remote sensing analysis workflows.
How: reading, learning by doing and writing


🎯 Learning Objectives

Appraise the process of image analysis and its relation to research.
Understand the physical principles of optical and radar-based remote sensing.
Distinguish the main steps for SAR images correction.
Apply advanced computational techniques to obtain thematic information from Earth Observation data.


Select Academic Year/Term:
 2023

title: 🗓️ Week 03 - SAR response of soil and crops
text:
In this week, we will review how soil and crops influence SAR response.
In addition, we will follow a tutorial to learn how to classify crop using SAR multitemporal data.
